channel.title: Qubes/whonix and "stream isolation" understanding for non-default applications
channel.description:
I do understand that Whonix is great reagrding "Stream-Isolation" with the routing trough differents "TorSocks" rather than standard "TransPort" offered by Tor..
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation
That "stream-isolation" is already configured inside Whonix, for preinstalled default packages, and one need to individually configure "TorSocks" routng for any other installed packages. (This is actually out of my knowledge).
But so, Inside Qubes, do I have any advantages to install applications that I want connected to TOR, inside a VM based on Whonix-ws template, rather than a standard Debian or Fedora templates routed to "sys-whonix" ?
Considering that this AppVM would be only used as domain for 1 Torified applications (Monero GUI for example) What is the advantage of whonix workstation template, rather than stripped-down fedora-minimal template in such case (so with no stream-isolation) ?
Thanks for your answers !

item.title: Qubes/whonix and "stream isolation" understanding for non-default applications
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
AnonGuy:

What is the advantage of whonix workstation template, rather than stripped-down fedora-minimal template in such case (so with no stream-isolation) ?

Non-technical

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Features
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Technical_Introduction#With_more_technical_terms

Technical

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Design-Workstation
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Source_Code_Intro
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Manually_Creating_Whonix

item.title: Qubes/whonix and "stream isolation" understanding for non-default applications
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi AnonGuy

Whonix

Other Operating Systems

Anonymize any Operating System! Your operating system tunneled through the Tor Anonymity Network! Create your Custom-Whonix-Workstation!

See also:

https://whonix.org/wiki/Other_Operating_Systems#Security_Comparison:_Whonix-Download-Workstation_vs._Whonix-Custom-Workstation

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes/whonix and "stream isolation" understanding for non-default applications
item.dc:creator: AnonGuy
item.description:
I do understand that Whonix is great reagrding “Stream-Isolation” with the routing trough differents “TorSocks” rather than standard “TransPort” offered by Tor…

Whonix

Stream Isolation

Prevent Identity Correlation through Circuit Sharing by using Tor Stream Isolation

That “stream-isolation” is already configured inside Whonix, for preinstalled default packages, and one need to individually configure “TorSocks” routng for any other installed packages. (This is actually out of my knowledge).

But so, Inside Qubes, do I have any advantages to install applications that I want connected to TOR, inside a VM based on Whonix-ws template, rather than a standard Debian or Fedora templates routed to “sys-whonix” ?

Considering that this AppVM would be only used as domain for 1 Torified applications (Monero GUI for example) What is the advantage of whonix workstation template, rather than stripped-down fedora-minimal template in such case (so with no stream-isolation) ?

Thanks for your answers !

Read full topic
